attributes.action: Invtervene, VC Hero as been denied permission to live in the UK, Gurkha Tul Bahadur Pun
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Would the prime minister please intervene with the application to live in the UK by one of it's military Heroes. Which has been refused by his governmental departments. (Working in his name).

Mr Pun earned his VC in Burma on June 23, 1944, whilst serving with 6th Gurkha Rifles. After almost all his comrades were wiped out. He seized a Bren Gun and, firing from the hip and running through ankle-deep mud, he ignored Japanese fire to storm machine gun positions. 

His official citation read: "His outstanding courage and superb gallantry in the face of odds which meant almost certain death were most inspiring and beyond praise." 

He was invited to the Queen's Coronation and had tea with the Queen Mother.

Yet, despite his illustrious record, his application to live in Britain has been refused. 

The old soldier was told: "You have failed to demonstrate that you have strong ties with the UK." 

What greater ties to a country do you need than to be awarded it's highest award "FOR VALOUR", whilst fighting for it's cause.

Please review and overturn this shamefull decision.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
